title: The problem of the barometer
subtitle: Students devise smart ways to measure the height of the building using barometer.
author: David Mikkelson
vclaim: The professor of physics offers a final test that requires his students to explain how the height of the tall building is measured using the barometer. Instead of the expected answer (i.e. measuring the barometric pressure at the top and bottom of the building, and then using those readings to calculate the height), one student offers several unique but technically correct alternative solutions to the problem.
